SEARCH
Package utils

Class TablePrinter

java.lang.Object
utils.TablePrinter
public class TablePrinter extends Object
Utility class for printing formatted tables in CLI applications. This class handles automatic column width calculation and consistent formatting to improve readability of tabular data throughout the application.

  • Constructor Details

    • TablePrinter

      public TablePrinter(String[] headers)
      Constructs a new table with the specified column headers.
      Parameters:
      headers - Array of column headers that define the table structure

  • Method Details

    • addRow

      public void addRow(String[] rowData)
      Adds a row of data to the table. The row must have the same number of columns as the table headers.
      Parameters:
      rowData - Array of string values representing one row of data
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the row data does not match the number of columns

    • addRow

      public void addRow(Object... rowData)
      Adds a row of data to the table using varargs for convenience. Automatically converts all objects to strings using their toString() method.
      Parameters:
      rowData - Variable number of objects representing one row of data
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the number of arguments does not match the number of columns

    • print

      public void print()
      Prints the formatted table to the console. Includes headers, a divider line, and all data rows with proper alignment.

    • padRight

      private String padRight(String s, int width)
      Helper method to pad a string to the right with spaces. Ensures consistent column alignment in the table.
      Parameters:
      s - String to pad
      width - Total width including string
      Returns:
      Padded string

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns the table as a formatted string. Useful for saving tables to files or including them in other text content.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      Formatted table as string

    • formatCell

      public static String formatCell(String value, int maxLength)
      Formats a value for display in a table cell, truncating if longer than maxLength. Useful for keeping table columns at a consistent width.
      Parameters:
      value - The string value to format
      maxLength - Maximum length before truncating
      Returns:
      Formatted string, truncated with ellipsis if necessary
